title: New bounds on a generalization of Tuza's conjecture
why_it_fails_nu4: Bridges can attach to 3 packing elements, breaking tau(T_e) <= 2 guarantee

lemmas.name: isTrianglePacking
lemmas.statement: def isTrianglePacking (G : SimpleGraph V) (S : Finset (Finset V)) : Prop := S ⊆ G.cliqueFinset 3 ∧ Set.Pairwise (S : Set (Finset V)) (fun t1 t2 => (t1 ∩ t2).card ≤ 1)

lemmas.name: trianglesSharingEdge
lemmas.statement: def trianglesSharingEdge (G : SimpleGraph V) (t : Finset V) : Finset (Finset V) := (G.cliqueFinset 3).filter (fun x => (x ∩ t).card ≥ 2)

lemmas.name: S
lemmas.statement: def S (G : SimpleGraph V) (t : Finset V) (M : Finset (Finset V)) : Finset (Finset V) := (trianglesSharingEdge G t).filter (fun x => ∀ m ∈ M, m ≠ t → (x ∩ m).card ≤ 1)

lemmas.name: lemma_2_2
lemmas.statement: lemma lemma_2_2 (M : Finset (Finset V)) (hM : isMaxPacking G M) (e : Finset V) (he : e ∈ M) : ∀ t1 t2, t1 ∈ S G e M → t2 ∈ S G e M → shareEdge t1 t2
lemmas.english: All triangles in S_e pairwise share edges
lemmas.proof_technique: Maximality contradiction - if t1, t2 don't share edge, M' = (M \ {e}) ∪ {t1, t2} is larger packing

lemmas.name: lemma_2_3
lemmas.statement: lemma lemma_2_3 (M : Finset (Finset V)) (hM : isMaxPacking G M) (e : Finset V) (he : e ∈ M) : trianglePackingNumberOn G ((G.cliqueFinset 3) \ (trianglesSharingEdge G e)) = trianglePackingNumber G - 1
lemmas.proof_technique: M \ {e} is valid packing in residual

lemmas.name: inductive_bound
lemmas.statement: lemma inductive_bound (M : Finset (Finset V)) (hM : isMaxPacking G M) (e : Finset V) (he : e ∈ M) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ triangleCoveringNumberOn G (trianglesSharingEdge G e) + triangleCoveringNumberOn G ((G.cliqueFinset 3) \ (trianglesSharingEdge G e))
lemmas.proof_technique: Union of covers for T_e and complement covers all

lemmas.name: covering_number_le_two_of_subset_four
lemmas.statement: lemma covering_number_le_two_of_subset_four (U : Finset V) (hU : U.card ≤ 4) (h_subset : ∀ t ∈ G.cliqueFinset 3, t ⊆ U) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2
lemmas.proof_technique: Case analysis on 0-4 vertices, explicit edge selection

lemmas.name: intersecting_family_structure_corrected
lemmas.statement: lemma intersecting_family_structure_corrected (S : Finset (Finset V)) (hS_nonempty : S.Nonempty) (hS : S ⊆ G.cliqueFinset 3) (h_pair : Set.Pairwise (S : Set (Finset V)) shareEdge) : isStar S ∨ isK4 S
lemmas.english: Pairwise edge-sharing triangles form a star OR fit in K4
lemmas.proof_technique: If 3 triangles don't share common edge, union has 4 vertices

lemmas.name: tau_star
lemmas.statement: lemma tau_star (S : Finset (Finset V)) (hS : S ⊆ G.cliqueFinset 3) (h_star : isStar S) : triangleCoveringNumberOn G S ≤ 1
lemmas.proof_technique: Common edge covers all triangles in star

lemmas.name: tau_S_le_2
lemmas.statement: lemma tau_S_le_2 (M : Finset (Finset V)) (hM : isMaxPacking G M) (e : Finset V) (he : e ∈ M) : triangleCoveringNumberOn G (S G e M) ≤ 2
lemmas.proof_technique: Combines intersecting_family_structure with tau_star and K4 bound

key_insight: At nu <= 3, can guarantee some e in M has tau(T_e) <= 2. At nu >= 4, bridges can attach to 3+ elements, breaking this.
notes: Our formalization matches this paper exactly. Parker's method is the foundation we build on.
